title: Multimodal Imaging of the Microbial Effect on the Oil-in-Water Bilgewater Emulsion
content: Bilgewater, an oil-in-water (O/W) emulsion, is a persistent pollutant released to the ocean from the lowest part of ships. Bilgewater is a regulated shipboard produced waste stream. Fundamental knowledge of emulsion surface changes is needed for improved wastewater treatment; however, limited information is currently available. Microbes play an important role in the ocean. It is hypothesized that microbes release organics that can act as surfactants that affect bilgewater formation or weakening. Such information will be critical for development mitigation strategies to treat polluted seawater containing bilgewater emulsions.
